page.title: 18Off the Beaten Track.
page.content: After going on the road for about half a mile, we climbed over a gate, and came to a spot where everything living was growing wild, and there was a hut that looked like a bomb-shelter. We all took it in turns to climb over another gate and through what seemed like a mini jungle, with its brambles and bushes and leaves. Then we had a rest by a bridge over a disused railway line. Mr Mantle stepped down to see if it was safe to cross. Then Mr Mantle came up and said it was dangerous, so went through a field. Inside the field, wheat was growing. Nicola Good found an old sixpence. We crossed a stream, and went through a field with sheep in it so we had to be quiet. Then we made our way back to school.
